doc:
Mara Wilson https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mara_Wilson 0 Mara Elizabeth Wilson (born July 24, 1987) is an American writer and former child actress. Her best known roles include Natalie Hillard in Mrs. Doubtfire (1993), Susan Walker in Miracle on 34th Street (1994), Matilda Wormwood in Matilda (1996), and Lily Stone in Thomas and the Magic Railroad (2000). Since retiring from film acting, Wilson has focused on writing, penning the play Sheeple which was produced for the New York International Fringe Festival in 2013 as well as publishing a memoir, Where Am I Now?: True Stories of Girlhood and Accidental Fame (2016). Mara_Elizabeth_Wilson ( born July_24_,_1987 ) is an_American_writer and former_child_actress . Her_best_known_roles include Natalie_Hillard in Mrs._Doubtfire_(_1993_) , Susan_Walker in Miracle on 34th_Street_(_1994_) , Matilda_Wormwood in Matilda_(_1996_) , and Lily_Stone in Thomas and the_Magic_Railroad_(_2000_) . Since retiring from film_acting , Wilson has_focused on writing , penning the_play_Sheeple which was_produced for the_New_York_International_Fringe_Festival in 2013_as_well_as publishing a_memoir , Where Am I Now ? : True_Stories of Girlhood and Accidental_Fame_(_2016_) .
